timeline.message: Set heap when running ES in docker test fixture

timeline.bodyText: Him, why is this needed? It's not a very realistic scenario since we require security manager outside of tests. This flag is really only meant for special cases like the evil-tests.
timeline.author: rjernst

replies.bodyText: This was mentioned by @jasontedor in #32572 (comment). I presume this is just because these tests are directly creating an HttpClient to hit a servlet vs using some other code path which is granted in our security policy (like the rest client itself).
replies.author: mark-vieira

replies.bodyText: Ah I see, since we were previously not extending ESTestCase, we were not triggering the test security manager to be installed.
replies.author: rjernst
